proposals.reasoning: This team follows the broadly supported structure of exactly one of Alice/Charlie plus one of Bob/Grace plus a quieter third. Alice is driving discussion and several players (Charlie, Diana, Frank) explicitly wanted at least one of the early drivers on the first mission to start generating reads. Between Bob and Grace, multiple players (Eve, Frank, Grace herself, Iris, Henry) were comfortable with Grace, and she fits the stable, low-conflict choice here. As Henry, I’m a quieter player who multiple people (Eve, Frank, Grace, Iris, Henry) suggested as a good third to avoid stacking only heavy talkers, and including myself lets others get a read on me early. Overall, Alice + Grace + Henry is the most consensus-aligned and information-generating low-risk configuration from the discussed options.

votes.comment: I’m on the team and my known evil teammates aren’t, so it’s a low-risk setup for me to build trust on Mission 1.
Contains one known evil (Alice) on a broadly accepted, low-suspicion first mission, giving us sabotage potential without looking out of line with consensus.
Team includes Alice, whom I argued to test early, and overall matches the broadly supported structure, so I’m fine sending it.
Solid, broadly supported structure for Mission 1 with reasonable info gain and no strong red flags yet.
Fits the broadly supported structure, avoids the main early suspicion (Diana), and gives us information on Alice with generally trusted Grace and a low-controversy third in Henry.
Matches the balanced structure I advocated (Alice + Grace + quieter third), has broad support, and Mission 1 is a good time to gather info without strong scumreads yet.
Team matches the broadly supported structure, includes me (known good to myself), and puts one of the talkative drivers on the first mission for info without any clear red flags.
Team fits the broadly supported structure, avoids the main early suspicions, and I know I’m good—solid info-gathering Mission 1 lineup.
I still prefer a first team that keeps both Alice and Charlie off so we can read them from the outside, like Bob/Grace plus a quieter third instead of including Alice here.

discussion.content: From what we’ve seen so far, I’m most comfortable sending Bob and Diana, and I’d round that out with someone who hasn’t been stirring much suspicion yet, like Grace.
Alice’s suggestion actually feels pretty reasonable to me — I’m comfortable going with Diana and Grace for this first mission unless someone has a strong read against either of them.

I’m mostly fine with Bob and Grace, but I’m a bit less sure about Diana this early — I’d actually rather see Alice go on the first mission since she’s the one pushing the plan and we can start building a read on her.

I’m fine being on the team, but I’d actually like at least one of Alice or Charlie on this first mission so we can start getting real info on the people driving the discussion. Maybe something like Alice, Bob, and me, or swap Bob for Grace if people are more comfortable with that.

I’d rather not send three people who are all kind of co-signing each other already, so I like having exactly one of Alice/Charlie plus one of Bob/Grace, and then a quieter third like Henry or Iris to spread the risk. If we *have* to pick from the names already on the table, I slightly prefer Alice, Bob, and Grace over including Diana this early.

I like Eve’s structure of exactly one of Alice/Charlie and one of Bob/Grace, but I’m uneasy about Diana for Mission 1, so I’d lean toward something like Alice, Grace, and Henry/Iris to keep it balanced.
I like the “one of Alice/Charlie, one of Bob/me, plus a quieter third” idea, and I’d lean toward including Iris or Henry as that third so we’re not putting all the early talkers on the same team.

I like the “one of Alice/Charlie + one of Bob/Grace + one quieter” structure too, and I’m okay with going myself if people want that—something like Alice, Grace, and me feels like a reasonable starting team.

I like the “one of Bob/Grace plus a quieter third” idea, but I’d actually prefer we keep both Alice and Charlie off this first team so we can read their reactions from the outside. Something like Bob, Grace, and Henry (or me) feels like a solid, low-drama start.

proposals.reasoning: Most of the table has coalesced around Bob–Diana–Eve as the safest core that avoids repeating the failed Henry/Grace team. Given the early fail, it makes sense to exclude both Henry and Grace this round to get a clean data point separate from Mission 1. For the fourth slot, the group sentiment has generally favored adding either Frank or me, and I previously voiced support for exactly this structure. Including myself as leader keeps the team consistent with that earlier discussion while still avoiding the controversial Mission 1 players and not auto-clearing anyone from the first mission. If this team passes, we’ll have a strong, relatively trusted block to lean on for future missions; if it fails, we get very clear suspicion on this new configuration without Henry/Grace muddying the waters.

votes.comment: This lines up with the consensus to exclude both Henry and Grace after the failed first mission, and Bob–Diana–Eve plus Iris gives us a fresh four to test without reusing too many from before.
This matches the consensus Bob–Diana–Eve core, excludes both Henry and Grace after the failed first mission, and gives us a clean info point with Iris as the fourth.
Has one of my known evil teammates on it and no need to block a strong chance at another fail this early.
Best consensus info-gathering team that avoids the Henry/Grace conflict; we need a fresh data point away from Mission 1, and any alternative is similarly risky but more contentious.
No overlap with the failed Mission 1 team; as a good player on this team I like using this round to test a clean block away from Henry/Grace and get clearer info.
Avoids both Henry and Grace after the failed first mission and matches the consensus Bob–Diana–Eve core plus a relatively neutral Iris; best chance so far for a clean success and good info.
Best to avoid the Henry/Grace pair after the fail and test a fresh block; Bob–Diana–Eve–Iris is a reasonable info-gathering team with good odds of being clean.
I don’t like completely excluding both me and Grace; it risks giving evil a clean-looking stacked team and denies us the info from splitting Henry/Grace across teams.
Team cleanly avoids the failed Henry/Grace group and gives us a strong info-gathering mission with players who’ve generally sounded reasonable so far.

discussion.content: Given that the first mission failed, I really don’t want to see both Henry and Grace back on the same team; I’d rather mix it up with people like Bob or Diana instead.

I agree we shouldn’t send both Henry and Grace together again, but with only one fail it’s hard to know which one (if either) is bad, so I’d rather see a team like me, Diana, Eve, and just one of Henry/Grace to test things.

I’m fine with splitting up Henry and Grace, but I also don’t love auto-clearing Alice just because there was only one fail—something like Bob, Diana, Eve, and *one* of Henry/Grace feels like a better mix than re-using too many from the first team.
I like the idea of only taking one of Henry/Grace for now, and I’m most comfortable with a team like Bob, Eve, me, plus just one of them so we can get some clearer info.

I’m mostly on board with Bob–Diana–me as a core, but given the first mission already failed I’d actually prefer we try a team that excludes both Henry and Grace this round to see if we can lock in a clean success and narrow things down.
I really like the idea of testing a team that completely avoids Henry and Grace this round—something like Bob, Diana, Eve, plus one of Charlie/Iris/me seems safest to try to lock in a clean success.

I definitely agree we shouldn’t repeat both me and Henry after that fail, and between the two of us I’m more suspicious of Henry right now, so I’d be happiest with something like Bob, Diana, Eve, plus Iris or Charlie as the fourth.

I get why people are nervous about me and Grace after the fail, but completely cutting both of us out plays into evil’s hands by giving them a free “clean-looking” team, so I’d rather see something like Bob, Diana, Eve, and **one** of me/Grace than neither of us. If you don’t want me specifically, I can accept sitting out this round, but then I’m going to be watching that no- Henry/no-Grace team very closely.

I’m on board with the Bob–Diana–Eve core, and I’d slightly rather round that out with Frank or me than pull Henry/Grace back in immediately, just so we get a clean info point away from the first mission. If that team passes, it gives us a really solid group to lean on later.

proposals.reasoning: Most of the table has converged on avoiding Henry, Bob, and Iris after two single-fail missions, and repeatedly suggested a core of Charlie/Grace/Diana/Eve as the cleanest way to get new information without reusing the riskiest overlaps. This team follows that consensus, keeps both previous leaders (Henry and Iris) off the mission, and uses only players who were either not on failed missions or are currently being treated as relatively more trusted by the group, which should maximize approval while giving us clearer alignment signals from a fresh combination.

votes.comment: Has one of my evil teammates on it and is widely accepted by the table, giving a strong chance to secure the third fail now.
Team includes an unseen mix and avoids the most-suspected players from failed missions, so it should give good info while minimizing perceived risk.
I’m on the team as evil; passing this gives me a chance to sabotage for the third fail and end the game.

At 0-2 we need the safest possible team; this one includes both leading suspects from the previous fails (Grace from M1 and Eve from M2), so I’d rather replace at least one of them with someone like Alice or Frank.

Team includes both Grace (from the first failed mission’s suspect set) and Diana (from the second), so this combo can easily contain two evils; I’d rather swap in someone like Frank or Alice instead of running both of them together.

This team reuses three players from the two failed missions (Grace, Diana, Eve), so it can easily contain multiple evils; I’d prefer a team built around Charlie plus fresh picks like me and Alice instead of loading up on prior overlaps.

This avoids the main suspects (Henry, Bob, Iris) after two single-fail missions and uses the Henry/Bob/Iris-free lineup I already supported, giving us fresh info with a reasonably safe-looking team that I’m on.

I know I’m good, so the Mission 1 fail points to Alice or Grace; Mission 2 points to one of Bob/Diana/Eve/Iris. It’s quite plausible the three evils are all outside this team (e.g. Alice/Bob/Iris), and this lineup matches the table’s consensus for a relatively clean test while keeping the riskiest overlaps (me, Bob, Iris) off.

I’m still not comfortable treating Charlie as the safest core pick after two single-fail missions; I’d rather see a variant that swaps Charlie out (e.g., bringing in Frank) to spread risk and get cleaner info.

discussion.content: Given the two single-fail missions, I really don’t want to see Henry or Bob on the next team; I’d feel safest with people who haven’t been on a failed mission yet, like Charlie plus a mix from Grace/Diana/Eve.

I get why people are side‑eyeing anyone on the failed teams, but with both being single sabotages I’m more suspicious of the leaders (Henry and Iris) than just the overlap, so I’d rather see something like Charlie plus a mix of Diana/Grace/Eve on this one.

From where I’m sitting, the safest thing right now is to avoid all three of Henry/Bob/Iris and go with a team like me, Grace, Diana, and Eve, and if people really want some overlap to “test,” I’d only consider swapping in Alice for one of them.
I like Charlie’s idea of avoiding Henry/Bob/Iris for now; a team of Charlie, Grace, Eve, and me feels like the cleanest info we can get without reusing people from the failed missions.

I’m obviously biased, but I know I’m good, so I’m on board with something like Charlie/Grace/Diana/me as a starting point, keeping Henry/Bob/Iris off for now. If people really want some overlap from earlier, I’d rather add Alice than bring any of those three back in yet.

I’m very wary of reusing Henry/Bob/Iris right now; I’d most trust a core of fresh-ish picks like Charlie and me, plus maybe Alice and one of Grace/Diana/Eve rather than loading up on people from the failed teams.

I’m fine with a Henry/Bob/Iris‑free team like Charlie/Grace/Diana/Eve this round, and between the overlaps so far I’m a bit more inclined to trust Alice than Henry or Bob if we do decide to add someone from earlier missions later.

Given both fails had only one sabotage, I get why people don’t want me/Bob/Iris back on yet, so I’m fine with a team like Charlie/Grace/Diana/Eve this round while we gather cleaner info. If we absolutely need overlap later, I’d lean toward testing Alice before re‑adding me or Bob.

Given both fails were single sabotages, I’d rather not treat Charlie as auto‑clear yet; a team like Grace/Diana/Eve plus Frank (I’m fine sitting out) feels like a better way to get new info without reusing too many risky overlaps.
